title:
Equivariant cohomological rigidity for four-dimensional Hamiltonian
  $\mathbf{S^1}$-manifolds
authors: Tara S. Holm, Liat Kessler, Susan Tolman
abstract:
For manifolds equipped with group actions, we have the following natural
question: To what extent does the equivariant cohomology determine the
equivariant diffeotype? We resolve this question for Hamiltonian circle actions
on compact, connected symplectic four-manifolds. They are equivariantly
diffeomorphic if and only if their equivariant cohomology rings are isomorphic
as algebras over the equivariant cohomology of a point. In fact, we prove a
stronger claim: each isomorphism between their equivariant cohomology rings is
induced by an equivariant diffeomorphism.
